task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 262°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the building (roofline and base) before estimating height, so I will tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
I’m no longer facing the target (now looking north), so I should rotate left to the west to bring the building back into view for height estimation.
I need to see the building’s roofline clearly to estimate total height, so I will tilt up while staying pointed west.
The view has again snapped to north, so I must rotate left to west to keep the target building in frame.
Rather than repeatedly tilting up, I should estimate height from this straight-on west view using visible floors and typical storey heights.
